title: Sam Smith's Spectre Theme Song: Daniel Craig & Monica Bellucci Kiss
text:

Sam Smith 's Spectre Bond Theme, Writing's On The Wall which has been creating a lot of buzz since weeks has been released finally. 
The Grammy winner shared the music video of Spectre's theme song on social media and he has delivered his soft soulful music and voice in the song. 
The music video opens with the 23-year-old singer standing in front of several Union Jack-draped coffins, dressed in a black suit. 
The video then shows the steamy hot lovemaking scenes between the lead actors, Daniel Craig and Monica Bellucci . 
Monica is the oldest ever Bond Girl in the franchise who will be seen in the 24th installment of James Bond film. Craig is seen unzipping her dress before the two engage in a steamy make-out session. 
The Italian actress is the oldest ever 'Bond Girl' but she has insisted on being called a 'Bond Lady' or 'Bond Woman'. 
After a few minutes, we see Craig's second Bond Girl LÃ©a Seydoux. Although 007 doesn't get as far as he did with Monica, there's plenty of sexual tension between the two which is visible in the scenes. 
Sam Smith beautifully showed love in an action packed film with his soaring falsetto and beautiful dark and brooding video. 
The Grammy winning singer has already topped the UK charts with his Spectre theme song, Writing's on the Wall. Adele 's Skyfall and Duran Duran's A View To Kill were the first two Bond songs to make it to the top spot on the list. It is also the first James Bond theme song recorded by a British male solo artist since 1965.
